info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 11:49AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN PREBLE, SOUTHEASTERN DARKE, NORTHERN MONTGOMERY AND SOUTHERN MIAMI COUNTIES THROUGH 1230 PM EDT... At 1149 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Arcanum, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph, half inch hail, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Dayton, Huber Heights, Troy, Trotwood, Vandalia, Englewood, Tipp City, New Carlisle, West Milton, Arcanum, Lewisburg, Pleasant Hill, New Madison, Brown, Riverside, Clayton, Union, Brookville, Wayne Lakes and Shiloh. This includes the following Interstates... I-70 in Ohio between mile markers 17 and 40. I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 57 and 75. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If this storm becomes stronger, then a warning may be needed. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
